div.div: ἠιόεις , εσσα: doubtful word, with changing banks, Il. 5.36†. (The above interpretation assumes a derivation from ἠιών, some rivers like the Scamander, in warm countries, with their sources in neighboring mountains, have in consequence of rains a broad rugged bed out of proportion to the ordinary size of the stream, and banks ragged and often high.)
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
